net.proteusframework.core.image

Class Thumbnailer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.image.Thumbnailer

  • public final class Thumbnailer
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to create thumbnail images. This class is intended to be an all-in-one shop for creating thumbnails from image data sources.

    This class utilizes the javax.imageio package for reading and writing images. As of JDK 1.4 the following formats are supported by javax.imageio.

    Image Support
      Reading Writing
    JPEG yes yes
    PNGyesyes
    BMP yes yes
    WBMP yes yes
    GIF yes no
    Support for writing GIF images is provided by GIFEncoder if there isn't a provider bundled with the JDK or an additional Image I/O plugin.
    Other image formats can be provided by creating additional service providers. See IIORegistry.

    Additional image I/O plugins can be downloaded from http://java.sun.com/products/java-media/jai/. At the time this class was written the following JAI Image I/O plugins (read/write) were available from sun (Java(TM) Advanced Imaging Image I/O Tools).
    • bmp
    • jpeg2000
    • pnm
    • gif
    • jpeg
    • png
    • tiff
    • wbmp
    • raw
    To make use of these additional image plugins, you will need to download a package from sun that is specific to your architecture and install it in your JDK.

    See the main method of this class for example code.

    Limitations:
    This class does not scale well for very large images since it uses buffered images.
    Please do not add methods to this class that are not related to creating thumbnail images.
    This class is not intended to be used to convert from one image type to another. It will work in some instances and not in others. What types of conversions will work depends on the addition of Image I/O plugins. Some conversions may or may not work after adding Image I/O plugins.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

      • createThumbnail

        public static void createThumbnail(java.io.File imageFile,
                                   java.io.File thumbnailFile,
                                   int maxWidth,
                                   int maxHeight)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Create a thumbnail. Original image height to width ratio is maintained, limiting the thumbnail by the given width and height. A zero (or negative) width or height results in no limit to the thumbnail in that dimension.
        Parameters:
        imageFile - the source image.
        thumbnailFile - the destination image.
        maxWidth - the maximumn width.
        maxHeight - the maximum height.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading or writing the files.

      • createThumbnailsInDirectory

        public static void createThumbnailsInDirectory(java.io.File sourceDirectory,
                                               java.io.File destDirectory,
                                               java.lang.String sourceFilePattern,
                                               java.lang.String destFileFormat,
                                               int width,
                                               int height)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.io.IOException
        Create thumbnail files in a directory. Supported writable image formats are specified in the package documentation of javax.imageio.

        Either width or height may not be specified by passing 0 as an argument, but not both. If one of the width or height arguments is not specified the other will be calculated based on the ratio of the specified argument to the source image (aspect ratio is maintained).

        The directory to find image files and create thumb nails for.

        Parameters:
        sourceDirectory - the source directory to scan for images.
        destDirectory - the destination directory for the thumbnails.
        sourceFilePattern - the file pattern used to match files in the source directory. This must be a regular expression. May be null.
        Example: "^.*.(?:gif|png|jpg)$"
        destFileFormat - the file format that will be used for the created thumbnail. May be null.

        Supported Variables
        $(width) - the width of the original image.
        $(height) - the height of the original image.
        $(tn-width) - the width of the thumbnail image.
        $(tn-height) - the height of the thumbnail image.
        $(file-name) - the orginal file name less the file extension.

        Defaults to "$(file-name)-small".

        width - the width.
        height - the height.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified arguments are invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getFastThumbnail(float percent)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get a thumbnail favoring speed over quality.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the resulting image.
        Throws:

        Returns:
